column3: Great evening, the performers were wonderful and the venue was comfortable and easy to see concert from most seats.

Torrance hosts lots of fun activities at the Cultural Arts Center. There's a theater, Japanese Garden (lovely!), art studios, and large areas for hometown fairs and festivals. Check them out online for their list of events.

The theater (may need tickets in advance) and Japanese garden (free) are lovely. Torrance has done a wonderful job with these venues and the surrounding Civic Center area. I highly recommend the cozy local theater for any type of show, and a quiet walk through the adjacent garden.
Have been to most of the rooms here including the main theater. This is a wonderful place. Great for families, children and adults!

The Cultural Center is made up of several buildings, from the Toyota Meeting Hall-- great for receptions, award ceremonies, seminar and craft events--to the Armstrong Theater--not a bad seat in the house. (the sound engineers really need professional training however. That is why it doesn't get a 5 star.)The Ken Miller Recreational center also great for dinners, dances, etc. There is an Art Center and also classes for yoga, martial arts and ethnic dancing. The Nakano Theater is a great intimate cabaret type venue for all sorts of musical or theatrical presentations, many of which are catered.

column2: Urban Renewal Project Concert & Dinner Show
column3: The actual concert was just so so, but the dinner was delicious as always. It was catered in. Weâ€™ve been to lots of concerts here and they are usually very good. It is a small venue site but the sound is great.At intermission they have delicious cookies and brownies catered from The Torrance Bakery. Great place to go and have some great music and a dinner if you like.
There are lots of events throughout the year at the Torrance Cultural Arts Center. It's free and accessible to all. I love this place and I recommend living in Torrance, too.

column2: Comfy venue dedicated to celebrating the arts
column3: We did the "dinner and a show" event during their cabaret series in October. My husband splurged so that I'd have a chance to see one of my favorite group of performers, Streetlight Cadence.We drove the 90 minutes (plus) from Disneyland and arrived at the venue about 40 minutes before the show was supposed to start. We had will call tickets, which caused a bit of a kerfuffle (three different people supplied three different directions on how to pick up said tickets), but in the end, everything was squared away and we were granted entrance.The "dinner" part of the "dinner and a show" was catering brought in specifically for the night. They were serving chicken curry with rice and a side salad. As they didn't have a vegetarian option available, I asked the ladies serving to just fill me up on salad and vegetables from the curry sauce, which they did.We found out too late that drinks weren't included in the price of the ticket, so my husband had to hunt down an ATM - thankfully, there's one onsite, very close to the theater. Five minutes later, money in hand, we each had a bottle of water to consume.The theater was a bit dark, and a tiny bit cramped. Most of the tables were reserved for their members, so it took a bit of shuffling for us to find a table to squat at. We lucked out in finding one with a good view to the stage and sat down to eat our dinner. Note - they said the tables sat 4 people, but I think that's a bit generous. Unless you *really* like the people you're dining with.The theater itself had great acoustics, and even enough space up front for the impromptu dance floor (granted, it was a dance floor for one lady only, but at least she had space to get jiggy wit' it...)Parking was free and plentiful, and the venue itself was easy to find. I'd definitely head back for another of their shows (they had some really intriguing ones lined up for next year.)

column2: Great Entertainment through the Torrance Culture Arts Center
column3: I am a season subscriber to plays and entertainment at the Armstrong Theater. They have some excellent performances. For a local theater in the South Bay it is a great place for entertainment. I have been a season subscriber for three or four years and I have enjoyed the performances. Unlike other larger theaters, this facility is easy to get to and there is no charge for parking. I highly recommend it.

My little great-granddaughters had their recitals at this center and the facility is beautiful and comfortable. Those that are physically challenged for walking, it is a little far from parking lot to the entrance.

column2: Great for Families or a couples night out
column3: Great place for family shows or an adult night out. The Theatre is great. Classes are held for all ages in a variety of areas and fill up quickly so register early!

column2: Great place to see local concert
column3: Recently saw a jazz band play here and it was a lot of fun. It is a bit tricky if you are challenged to walk as the decline to get to the seats is steep.

column2: Home of the TCTV awards and much more!
column3: Weddings for a reasonable price, and home of the TCTV awards, where I was producer of the year 4x in a row and producer of 216 cable ACCESS shows. Nice locale, great parking, near the Torrance Library, and Japanese Garden.
This is an excellent place to visit in Torrance. Besides an excellent library, there are paintings and sculptures on display and a good Auditorium

I have either participated in or been a guest at several of the annual Japanese Bunkasai festivals there. Once I won the raffle even, a family trip to the Elephant Bar. In 2012 they had a piano there for a month outside as part of an international event, and I remember playing that piano at the time and appreciated that Torrance has interesting cultural activities

In the center the entreatment is unbelievable , for example there are different, ballet, Comedy, musical,needless to say one can spend an entire day justsimply walking the grounds.so much also, for childrenhuge swimming pool ,lesson , they have a vase program of different classes, such as piano, ballet,languages, Spanish, ESL, Japanese, art,

The community space is a hidden gem. There is a theater, performance space, large meeting rooms, one with a stage, two commercial kitchens, classrooms, a tiny Japanese Garden, and outside courtyard. It is well-maintained and used by Parks and Rec classes, for wedding receptions, cultural arts programs, plays, etc.

column2: What would we do without the Torrance Cultural Arts Center?
column3: Being a long time resident of the South Bay I can say that I've been using the facilities for over 20 years. The hula show is a big hit every year and my nephews play in a band that plays here. Friends have been married here in the Japanese Garden.What makes it great are the people. Every time I start a new class, a staff member greets me with a smile ready to guide students to their classes. I take a fitness class here and have tried several over the last decade. The prices are excellent and my current instructor is the best yet! Terri teaches a boot camp style Step and Circuit class that is probably the most challenging I've ever taken, and I've tried many over my lifetime. She is low impact but high results. I feel stronger than I've ever felt in my life. I owe it all to Torrance Cultural Arts Center and Terri!

This is a lovely local theatre offering a good range of productions. I don't think there's a bad seat in the house. Only quibble is that the entry to each row is slanted very strangely and can be difficult, especially for people with mobility issues.
The Arts Committee schedules some great shows and the wide selection keeps it interesting. Parking can be tight.

Wonderful venue. A reasonably priced entertainment option for the beach area. You can sit anywhere in the Armstrong Theater and have a good seat. Plenty of parking at no cost. A full bar is offered and we had a chance to meet the stars of the show after.

There is always something going on here. They hold classes for adults and kids. They host numerous event (Craft Faires, Cultural Programs). They also have a great theater where you can see wonderful plays, musicians etc year round.
The Torrance Cultural Arts Center has all kinds of events, from theater to concerts to multi-cultural events. There is, also, a lovely garden that is perfect for quiet contemplation or talks.

column2: A nice place to go visit as well as see a concert
column3: This place is indeed a nice concert venue to go see a concert as well as take in other things that go on there. So if you want a nice place to go and see some great programs and see a nice venue for concerts. Go to this place it is really overall very nice.
Excellent, relatively intimate concert facility.Good parking.Signage a tad confusing from the street actually finding the theatre. A tad dark walking around there at night.

Although its not open standard hours we were able to walk thru the charming parts of old Torrence then meet with the museum folks who answered all our questions. They were so thrilled at our level of interest! Very enjoyable
I went to a seminar/expo and walked around the grounds. They are beautifully kept and peaceful. It looks like it would be a great place to hold an event like a wedding.

I used to take my kids there for piano lessons, ballet class, and art class. The classes were very affordable but registering for the classes were a pain. If you don't log on at 8am the day registration starts, the class you want might not be there anymore. Sometimes even when you log in as soon as registration opens the classes are already full. In terms of tourist visiting there really isn't anything to see. They have a small garden that is nice but it's so small you can see it in one glance.

Wonderful city cultural center. Lot of talented people exhibiting their art work. Very encouraging place for those so inclined with artistic talent. Happens not to be me, but I can still enjoy the exhibits.

column2: Great center for art and other cultural events
column3: Have taken several art and dance classes at this location. It is close to the civic library as well, which makes it so convenient. It has some great shows, performances and cultural festivals and it is a beautiful spot
This is a very nicely appointed art gallery. something for everyone! Enjoy!

column2: Always have fun family events and Great Classes
column3: I've been taking a Polynesian class here for the past 4 years and it's been great. I've taken other classes here before, as well. they have a great offering each season for everyone and for all ages.

The plays we have seen there have been well presented. Very good local talent. We saw Chicago in July and were pleasantly surprised. We had seen this on Broadway, NYC and also the movie. Their production was excellent for a local company.
